validate-commit-msg.helpMessage:
Need help? We're currently using a commit convention that is outlined here:
https://github.com/conventional-changelog/conventional-changelog/blob/v0.5.3/conventions/angular.md

We use this convention in order to make contributions to the project clear and predictable.

Currently, we support the following types: feat, fix, docs, style, refactor, perf, test, chore, revert.

You can use these types in your commit message in the following fashion:

$ git commit -m "<type>(<scope>): some commit message here"
